title: Mercedes-Benz A-Class
summary: The Mercedes-Benz A-Class is a subcompact car produced by the German automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz as the brand's entry-level vehicle. The first generation (internally coded W168) was introduced in 1997, the second generation (W169) in late 2004 and the third generation (W176) in 2012. The fourth generation model (W177), which was launched in 2018, will mark the first time the A-Class is offered in the United States and Canada.[1] This fourth generation A-Class will also be the first to be offered both as a hatchback (W177) and sedan (V177).[2]
